creditline: Gift of J. Lionberger Davis, Class of 1900

texts.textentryhtml:
Duc d'Orleans, in Galerie du Palais Royal
Walkuers, Brussels
Laborde de Mereville
Francis  Egerton, Duke of Bridgewater, d. 1803.
George Granville Leveson-Gower, Earl of Gower, then Marquis of Stafford (1803), then (1833) Duke of Sutherland. Nephew of Duke of B.; d. 1846.
Francis Leveson-Gower. Son of Duke of B.; created first Earl of Ellesmere in 1846.
Sold from Ellesmere Collection in 1946. Christie's, Catalogue of Ancient and Modern Pictures, A portion of the Bridgewater Collection, October 17, 1946, p.18, no. 137.
Bruton Kent, Ltd., London.
J. Lionberger Davis (bought from Bruton Kent in Jan. 1948); 1952 gift to Princeton University Art Museum.
